meanings.definition: Prohibited or forbidden by social custom or practice.
meanings.sent1: Wearing mismatched socks was considered tabued at the formal event.
meanings.sent2: It is tabued to speak loudly in the library.
meanings.sent3: He found it amusingly tabued to wear a hat indoors.
meanings.sent4: Her unconventional ideas were seen as tabued by the traditional community.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual was so tabued that no one dared to speak of it.

meanings.definition: Avoided or shunned as improper or unacceptable.
meanings.sent1: The old house on the hill was tabued by the townspeople.
meanings.sent2: She felt tabued by her classmates for being different.
meanings.sent3: It was amusingly tabued to wear shorts in the snow.
meanings.sent4: His eccentric behavior made him tabued in the conservative neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The forbidden forest was so tabued that even the bravest adventurers hesitated to enter.
